greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If A082284(n) = 0, a(n) = 1, otherwise a(n) = 1 + a(A082284(n)), where A082284(n) = smallest number k such that k - d(k) = n, or 0 if no such number exists, and d(n) = the number of divisors of n (A000005).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
example: Starting from n = 21, we get the following chain: 21 -> 23 -> 27 -> 29 -> 31 -> 35 -> 37, with A082284 iterated 6 times before the final term 37 (for which A060990(37) = A082284(37) = 0) is encountered. Here we count the terms (not steps) in whole chain, thus a(21) = 7.
xref: Number of significant terms on row n of A265751 (without its trailing zeros).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 21 2015
